description: From Middle English revilen, from re + Old French aviler (“to make vile or cheap, disprize, disesteem”), from a- (“to”) + vil (“vile, cheap”); see vile.

verbs.description: revile (third-person singular simple present reviles, present participle reviling, simple past and past participle reviled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To attack (someone) with abusive language.
examples: who, when he was reviled, reviled not again
